v2.2.0 — Store Switching & Mobile UX

• Enhanced authentication with server-side validation

welcome.title: Welcome to electis Space
welcome.content:
Welcome! electis Space is your all-in-one platform for managing Electronic Shelf Labels (ESL) powered by SoluM AIMS. Whether you're organizing office desks, assigning lockers, managing conference rooms, or labeling retail spaces, this app makes it simple.
Here's what you can do:
• Spaces Mode: Manage physical locations (rooms, desks, shelves) and display their information on electronic labels.
• People Manager Mode: Assign people to spaces dynamically — perfect for hot-desking, event seating, or locker assignments.
• Conference Rooms: Keep meeting room displays up to date with schedules, participants, and availability.
• Real-Time Sync: All changes are automatically synchronized with the SoluM AIMS platform and displayed on labels within seconds.
This manual covers everything you need to get started and make the most of the platform. Use the tabs above to jump to any topic.

navigation.title: Navigating the App
navigation.content:
The app is organized into clear sections, accessible from the navigation bar at the top of the screen:
• Dashboard: Your home screen showing connection status, system statistics, quick actions (link label, add space/person, add conference room), and a quick overview of all modules.
• Spaces / People: The main workspace. Depending on your mode, you'll see either the Spaces table or the People Manager. Switch modes in Settings.
• Conference Rooms: Manage meeting room information and display data.
• Labels: View and manage electronic shelf labels — link/unlink labels to articles, view battery and signal status.
Additional controls in the top-right corner:
• Company/Store Selector: Switch between companies and stores. Changing a store instantly refreshes all data — no need to log out and back in.
• Language Toggle: Switch between English and Hebrew instantly. The entire interface, including this manual, adapts to your selection.
• Help Button: Opens this manual at any time.
• Settings Gear: Access system configuration (admin only).
• User Menu: View your profile, change your password, or log out.

firstSetup.title: Initial Setup
firstSetup.content:
Getting started is quick. Here's how to set up your system for the first time:
1. Log In: Use the credentials provided by your administrator. If this is a fresh installation, a default Platform Admin account is created during setup.
2. Create a Company: Go to Settings > Companies tab and click 'Create Company'. Enter your SoluM AIMS credentials (cluster, username, password) and the wizard will connect to AIMS and let you select your store.
3. Invite Users: In Settings > Users tab, create accounts for your team members. Assign appropriate roles (see Roles & Permissions below).
4. Configure Your Store: Once connected, your article format is automatically fetched from AIMS. Spaces and labels will begin syncing.
5. Choose Your Mode: Under your store settings, decide whether to use Spaces mode (default) or People Manager mode.
That's it — you're ready to manage your labels!

roles.title: Roles & Permissions
roles.content:
electis Space uses a role-based access system with four levels:
• Platform Admin: Full access to everything. Can create companies, manage all users, and configure the entire platform. Typically reserved for IT administrators.
• Company Admin: Manages a specific company and all its stores. Can create stores, manage users within the company, and configure AIMS connections.
• Store Admin: Manages a specific store. Can edit spaces, people, conference rooms, and configure store-level settings.
• User: View-only access with limited editing capabilities. Can view data and perform basic operations within their assigned store.
Each user is assigned to a company and one or more stores. You can only see and manage data for stores you have access to. Role assignment is done by admins in Settings > Users.

overview.title: What Are Spaces?
overview.content:
Spaces are the core building blocks of electis Space. Each space represents a physical location or item that has an electronic label: a desk, a room, a locker, a shelf position, or any other labeled spot.
Every space has:
• An External ID: A unique identifier that matches the article ID in SoluM AIMS. This is how the system knows which label to update.
• Data Fields: Custom information displayed on the label. The fields available depend on your company's article format configuration in AIMS.
• Sync Status: Whether the space's data is up to date with AIMS (synced, pending, or error).
Spaces are the default operating mode. When you open the main workspace, you'll see a table of all spaces in your store. Each row represents one space and shows all its data fields.

management.title: Managing Spaces
management.content:
The Spaces table provides a full set of tools for working with your spaces:
• Adding Spaces: Click the '+' button in the toolbar. Enter a unique External ID and fill in the data fields. The space will be created in the database and pushed to AIMS.
• Editing: Click any row to edit its data fields inline. Changes are saved automatically and queued for AIMS synchronization.
• Deleting: Select spaces using the checkboxes and click the delete button. This removes them from both the database and AIMS.
• Search & Filter: Use the search bar at the top to instantly filter the table. Searches across all data fields simultaneously.
• Sorting: Click any column header to sort the table. Click again to reverse the order.
• CSV Import: Click the upload button to import spaces from a CSV file. The file headers should match your article format field names.
• CSV Export: Download all spaces as a CSV file for reporting or backup.
All changes are automatically queued for synchronization — you don't need to manually push anything.

dataFields.title: Data Fields & Mapping
dataFields.content:
Each space has data fields defined by your company's article format in SoluM AIMS. The article format determines what information is available and how it maps to the label display.
Key concepts:
• Article Format: Fetched automatically from AIMS when you connect. Defines the columns in your spaces table (e.g., ARTICLE_ID, ITEM_NAME, NFC_URL, and any custom fields).
• Mapping Info: Tells the system which fields correspond to the article ID, article name, NFC URL, and store. These are set in your AIMS configuration.
• Global Field Assignments: Company-wide constants that apply to every article (e.g., a common NFC_URL prefix). Configured in Settings > Field Mapping.
• Field Mapping: You can configure how your company's fields map to AIMS article fields in Settings. This is especially useful when your data source uses different column names than AIMS expects.
Tip: If you add new fields in your AIMS article format, the spaces table will automatically show them after the next sync.

labels.title: Label Assignment
labels.content:
Electronic Shelf Labels (ESL) are the physical e-ink displays that show your space information. Here's how they work with electis Space:
• Automatic Display: When a label is linked to a space in AIMS, it automatically displays the space's data. No manual configuration needed in this app.
• Label Count: The toolbar shows how many spaces have linked labels vs. total spaces. This helps you track deployment progress.
• Label Status: The SoluM AIMS platform tracks label battery, signal strength, and display status. Use the SoluM AIMS dashboard for detailed label monitoring.
• Linking Labels: Labels are typically linked to spaces using the SoluM Picks mobile app or the AIMS web interface. You scan the label's barcode and associate it with an article ID.
• Blink/Identify: Need to find a specific label? Use the blink feature in AIMS to flash the label's LED for easy identification.
Remember: electis Space manages the data content — what appears on labels. The physical label management (linking, battery monitoring, firmware updates) is done through SoluM AIMS directly.

overview.title: What Is People Manager?
overview.content:
People Manager mode transforms electis Space into a dynamic people-to-space assignment system. Instead of managing static space data, you import a list of people and assign them to numbered spaces (slots).
Common use cases:
• Hot-Desking: Assign employees to available desks each day. Their name and details appear on the desk's electronic label.
• Locker Assignments: Assign lockers to employees or students. The label shows who owns each locker.
• Event Seating: Upload a guest list and assign seats. Each seat's label displays the assigned person's name.
• Temporary Arrangements: Quickly reassign spaces for meetings, training sessions, or reorganizations.
How it works:
1. Upload a CSV file with your people list (names, IDs, and any additional data fields).
2. Assign people to numbered space slots — manually or automatically.
3. The system pushes each assignment to AIMS, and the corresponding label updates with the person's information.
4. Save your assignment as a named list so you can reload it later.
To enable People Manager, go to Settings and toggle 'Enable People Manager Mode' for your store.

csvImport.title: Importing People (CSV)
csvImport.content:
The People Manager uses CSV files as its data source. Here's how to prepare and import your people list:
Preparing Your CSV File:
• The first row must contain column headers that match your article format field names (e.g., ITEM_NAME, DEPARTMENT, PHONE).
• Each subsequent row represents one person.
• Encoding: UTF-8 is recommended. UTF-8 with BOM is also supported for Hebrew text.
• Delimiter: Comma (,) is the default. Semicolons and tabs are also auto-detected.
Importing:
1. Click the 'Upload CSV' button in the People Manager toolbar.
2. Select your file. The system parses it and displays a preview.
3. People are loaded into the table with their data fields populated.
4. You can now assign them to spaces.
Tips:
• If your CSV has more columns than your article format, the extra columns are ignored.
• You can re-upload a CSV at any time — it replaces the current people list.
• People without assignments are shown in the 'Unassigned' section of the table.

assignments.title: Assigning Spaces
assignments.content:
Once your people are loaded, assign them to numbered space slots:
Single Assignment:
• Click the assign icon next to any person's row. They'll be assigned to the next available slot.
• You can also type a specific slot number to assign them to a particular space.
Bulk Assignment:
• Select multiple people using the checkboxes in the table.
• Click 'Assign Selected' in the toolbar. People are assigned to consecutive available slots.
Automatic Assignment:
• Click 'Assign All' to automatically assign all unassigned people to available slots in order.
Removing Assignments:
• Click the 'X' button on an assigned person's row to remove their space assignment.
• Use 'Remove All Assignments' in the toolbar to clear all assignments at once.
Progress Tracking:
• The progress bar at the top shows: [assigned] / [total slots available].
• Total Spaces is configured in your store settings. It determines how many numbered slots are available (1, 2, 3, ... N).
• When a person is unassigned, their slot reverts to an empty placeholder in AIMS, keeping the label visible.

lists.title: Lists & Saved Configurations
lists.content:
Lists let you save, manage, and quickly switch between different assignment configurations:
Saving a List:
• After making your assignments, click the 'Save List' button in the toolbar.
• Give your list a descriptive name (e.g., 'Monday Team A', 'Event Setup', 'Default Layout').
• The list saves the complete state: all people and their current assignments.
Loading a List:
• Click on any saved list in the lists panel to load it. The people and assignments are restored exactly as they were.
• After loading, click 'Apply Assignments' to activate the assignments and push them to AIMS.
Managing Lists:
• Rename or delete lists from the lists panel.
• Lists are stored on the server and available across all devices.
Syncing to AIMS:
• When you apply a list, all assignments are pushed to AIMS in one batch.
• The _LIST_MEMBERSHIPS_ field in AIMS stores list membership data, allowing cross-device synchronization.
• Use 'Sync to AIMS' to persist list data for access from other devices or sessions.
Tip: Create separate lists for different shifts, events, or departments for quick switching.

overview.title: Conference Room Displays
overview.content:
The Conference Rooms module lets you manage electronic labels placed outside meeting rooms. Each label displays the room's current status: whether it's available, the current meeting name, time, and participants.
Conference room articles use a special ID prefix ('C' + room ID) to distinguish them from regular spaces in AIMS. This means conference rooms and regular spaces can coexist in the same store without conflicts.
The module works in both Spaces mode and People Manager mode — conference rooms are always available regardless of which mode is active.

rooms.title: Managing Rooms
rooms.content:
Adding a Conference Room:
• Click 'Add Room' in the Conference Rooms toolbar.
• Enter the room's external ID (this becomes 'C' + ID in AIMS) and a display name.
• The room is created and synced to AIMS immediately.
Editing Room Information:
• Click on any room row to open the edit dialog.
• Update the room name, meeting details, schedule, and participant information.
• Changes are saved and queued for AIMS synchronization.
Deleting a Room:
• Select rooms using checkboxes and click the delete button.
• The room is removed from both the database and AIMS.
Field Mapping:
• Conference rooms map their meeting data to specific AIMS fields. The mapping is configured in Settings > Field Mapping > Conference Mapping.
• Default fields: Meeting Name, Meeting Time (start - end format), and Participants (comma-separated list).
• If no mapping is configured, the system uses a legacy fallback with generic data1-data5 fields.

meetings.title: Meeting Information
meetings.content:
Each conference room can display the following information on its electronic label:
• Room Name: The display name shown at the top of the label (e.g., 'Board Room', 'Room 301').
• Meeting Name: The title of the current or upcoming meeting.
• Start & End Time: The meeting schedule in your preferred format.
• Participants: A comma-separated list of attendee names.
• Status: Automatically determined — 'MEETING' when a meeting is active, 'AVAILABLE' when the room is free.
Updating Meeting Data:
• Open the room edit dialog and enter the meeting details.
• Click 'Save' to push the update to AIMS. The label updates within seconds.
• To clear a meeting (mark room as available), simply remove the meeting name and times.
Tip: For dynamic calendar integration, conference room data can be updated programmatically through the API, allowing you to connect it with your organization's calendar system (Outlook, Google Calendar, etc.).

howItWorks.title: How Synchronization Works
howItWorks.content:
electis Space uses a server-side synchronization engine to keep your data perfectly in sync with SoluM AIMS. Here's how it works:
Two-Way Sync Architecture:
• Push: When you create, edit, or delete items in electis Space, changes are queued and pushed to AIMS via the sync queue. Each item in the queue is processed with retry logic and error handling.
• Reconciliation: Every 60 seconds, a background reconciliation job compares your database with AIMS. It automatically pushes missing or outdated articles, and removes stale ones.
The Server is the Source of Truth:
• Your electis Space database is always authoritative. If AIMS has stale data, the reconciliation job corrects it.
• This means you never lose data — even if AIMS temporarily goes down, changes are queued and pushed when connectivity is restored.
Batching:
• Large updates are automatically batched in groups of up to 500 articles per AIMS API call, respecting AIMS rate limits.
• Token caching and singleflight patterns prevent duplicate authentication requests.

realTime.title: Real-Time Status
realTime.content:
electis Space provides live feedback on your sync status through several indicators:
Connection Indicator (bottom-left corner):
• Green: Connected to AIMS and sync is healthy.
• Blue (pulsing): A sync operation is currently in progress.
• Red: An error occurred during the last sync attempt.
• Gray: Disconnected from AIMS or sync is disabled.
Dashboard:
• The Dashboard shows your current connection status, last sync time, and counts for each module (spaces, people, conference rooms).
• Any sync errors are displayed prominently so you can address them quickly.
Server-Sent Events (SSE):
• The app maintains a live connection to the server. When sync operations complete on the server side, the frontend is notified immediately.
• This means your table updates in real-time — no need to refresh the page after syncing.

manualSync.title: Manual Sync
manualSync.content:
While automatic sync handles most scenarios, you can trigger manual sync operations when needed:
• Sync Button: Click the sync icon in the toolbar to trigger an immediate reconciliation of your current store.
• Full Reconciliation: This compares every article in your database against AIMS and fixes any discrepancies.
• Sync Queue: View the sync queue in the Sync page to see pending, processing, completed, and failed items.
• Retry Failed Items: If a sync item fails (e.g., due to a temporary network issue), you can retry it from the queue view.
When to Use Manual Sync:
• After making bulk changes (large CSV import, mass assignment changes).
• If you notice a label isn't displaying the latest data.
• After restoring an AIMS connection that was temporarily down.
• When you want to verify everything is in sync after configuration changes.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.content:
If you're experiencing sync issues, work through these steps:
1. Check Connection: Is the connection indicator green? If not, go to Settings and verify your AIMS credentials.
2. Verify Credentials: Ensure your AIMS username and password are correct. Try the 'Test Connection' button in the company settings.
3. Check the Sync Queue: Go to the Sync page and look at the queue. Are items stuck in 'Processing' or 'Failed' status?
4. Review Logs: Check Settings > System Logs for detailed error messages. Look for entries tagged [AimsReconcile] or [SyncQueue].
5. Network Issues: Ensure the server can reach the AIMS API (eu.common.solumesl.com). Firewall rules or proxy settings may block access.
6. Token Expiry: If you see 401/403 errors, the AIMS token may have expired. The system handles this automatically with retry logic, but persistent auth failures indicate incorrect credentials.
7. Rate Limiting: If you see 429 errors, AIMS is rate-limiting your requests. The system backs off automatically. Wait a few minutes and try again.
8. Contact Support: If none of the above resolves the issue, contact your SoluM administrator for help with AIMS-side configuration.

overview.title: Settings Overview
overview.content:
Access Settings by clicking the gear icon in the top-right corner. Available settings depend on your role:
Settings Sections:
• Companies: Create and manage companies (Platform Admin only). Each company has its own AIMS connection.
• Users: Manage user accounts and role assignments.
• Stores: Configure store-level settings, sync preferences, and display options.
• Field Mapping: Configure how your data fields map to AIMS article fields.
• System Logs: View detailed application logs for troubleshooting.
Quick Reference:
• Only Platform Admins and Company Admins can access company and user management.
• Store Admins can modify store settings and field mappings.
• Regular Users have limited access to settings.

companies.title: Companies & Stores
companies.content:
electis Space supports multiple companies, each with their own AIMS connection and stores.
Creating a Company:
1. Go to Settings > Companies and click 'Create Company'.
2. Enter a unique company code (3+ uppercase letters, e.g., 'ACME').
3. Enter your SoluM AIMS credentials: select the cluster (C1 or Common), and provide your AIMS username and password.
4. Click 'Connect & Fetch' — the system connects to AIMS and retrieves available stores.
5. Select a store from the list and give it a friendly name.
6. Enter the company display name and click 'Create'.
Managing Companies:
• Edit company details (name, location, description) from the Companies tab.
• Test or update AIMS connections from the company edit dialog's AIMS Config tab.
• Active/Inactive toggle controls whether the company's stores participate in sync.
Store Management:
• Each company can have multiple stores. Stores represent physical locations with their own ESL labels.
• Store settings include: sync enabled/disabled, people manager mode toggle, total spaces count, and display preferences.

users.title: Users & Roles
users.content:
Manage who can access the system and what they can do.
Creating a User:
1. Go to Settings > Users and click 'Add User'.
2. Fill in the user's email, first name, last name, and initial password.
3. Select a role: Platform Admin, Company Admin, Store Admin, or User.
4. Assign the user to a company.
5. Assign one or more stores the user can access.
6. Click 'Create' — the user can now log in.
Managing Users:
• Edit any user's details, role, or store assignments from the Users tab.
• Toggle a user's active status to disable their account without deleting it.
• Reset passwords or update email addresses as needed.
• Platform Admins can see and manage all users. Company Admins can only manage users within their company.
Best Practices:
• Follow the principle of least privilege — assign the minimum role needed for each person's responsibilities.
• Use Company Admin for department managers who need to configure their own stores.
• Use Store Admin for on-site managers who handle day-to-day label operations.

aimsConfig.title: AIMS Configuration
aimsConfig.content:
The AIMS (SoluM) connection is configured per company. Each company has its own credentials and can connect to different AIMS clusters.
Connection Settings:
• Cluster: Choose between 'C1' (eu.common.solumesl.com/c1/common) and 'Common' (eu.common.solumesl.com/common) based on your SoluM account.
• Username: Your AIMS account email address.
• Password: Your AIMS account password. Passwords are encrypted at rest in the database.
• The system automatically handles token management, caching, and refresh.
Testing the Connection:
• Use the 'Test Connection' button in the company edit dialog to verify your credentials.
• A successful test means the system can authenticate and communicate with AIMS.
• If the test fails, double-check your cluster selection and credentials.
Field Mapping:
• The article format is automatically fetched from AIMS and defines what data fields are available.
• Configure field mapping in Settings to control how your data maps to AIMS article fields.
• Global Field Assignments let you set company-wide constants (e.g., a default NFC_URL) that apply to every article.
• Conference Mapping configures which AIMS fields display meeting name, time, and participants for conference rooms.
